description: Gets latest price for a specific contract.
title: Price Proposal Request

subscribe.description: [Optional] 1 - to initiate a realtime stream of prices. Note that tick trades (without a user-defined barrier), digit trades and less than 24 hours at-the-money contracts for the following underlying symbols are not streamed: R_10, R_25, R_50, R_75, R_100, RDBULL, RDBEAR (this is because their price is constant).

passthrough.description: [Optional] Used to pass data through the websocket, which may be retrieved via the echo_req output field.

amount.description: Proposed contract payout or stake, or multiplier (for lookbacks).

trading_period_start.description: Required only for multi-barrier trading. Defines the epoch value of the trading period start time.

duration_unit.description: [Optional] Duration unit - s(seconds), m(minutes), h(hours), d(days), t(ticks).

date_expiry.description: Epoch value of the expiry time of the contract. Either date_expiry or duration is required.

currency.description: This can only be the account-holder's currency (obtained from payout_currencies call).

barrier2.description: Low barrier for the contract (for contracts with two barriers). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Volatility Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers. Not needed for lookbacks.

barrier.description: Barrier for the contract (or last digit prediction for digit contracts). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Volatility Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers. Not needed for lookbacks.

date_start.description: [Optional] Indicates epoch value of the starting time of the contract. If left empty, the start time of the contract is now.

symbol.description: The short symbol name (obtained from active_symbols call).

selected_tick.description: The tick that is predicted to have the highest/lowest value - for tickhigh and ticklow contracts.

duration.description: Duration quantity. Either date_expiry or duration is required.

basis.description: Indicates whether amount is 'payout' or 'stake' for binary options, and 'multiplier' for lookbacks.

req_id.description: [Optional] Used to map request to response.
